arts.sum: Salop had not won in four before this game, while Rovers had not won in three - and you could tell inside the opening 20 minutes as both teams lacked quality. The first chance of the game went Town’s way when Luca Hoole crossed for Funso Ojo, and the midfielder’s header was tipped over the bar by Jed Ward.

arts.ttl: 'Heart and soul: Gareth Ainsworth hails Shrewsbury Town stalwart Pam Coe ahead of Bristol Rovers tribute
arts.sum: “If we could have won the game for Pam it would have been the icing on the cake, especially for her partner Dave who has again been an integral part of the spirit," said Ainsworth. Moreover, Pam would travel to away games with her partner Dave to help medical staff and the club’s kitman to unload equipment.

arts.ttl: "Everyone knows" Shrewsbury Town boss aware of magnitude of clashes
arts.sum: “We have got 12 huge games. I want to focus on the present and try and pick up points and give us a fighting chance of staying up.

arts.ttl: Shrewsbury Town's clash with Bristol Rovers brings up odd Weetabix ritual
arts.sum: So the following day, when fans and Weetabix arrived at Gay Meadow, the away following noticed a group of birds on the pitch. Jamie Padden, a lifelong Rovers fan, said: "I can't remember what the game was or even the exact date – it was late 80s or early 90s – but I do remember the Weetabix.
